title: Black Friday 2022: Our pick of the best offers in the early sales
description: From phones and earbuds to tablets and Chromebooks, prices are tumbling at many retailers ahead of Black Friday.

title: Google just made the Pixel 7 the first 64-bit-only Android phone
description: Say goodbye to 32-bit app support on the Pixel 7 series.

title: Arm sets up legal showdown with Qualcomm, Nuvia (Update: New counterclaim)
description: Update: Qualcomm has asserted that its license rights protect its custom CPU efforts.

title: Google Messages users stumble onto new security feature in the works
description: End-to-end encryption appears to be in the early stages of testing for group chats.

title: Poll: What do you think of benchmark tests for smartphones?
description: Do you have a lot of faith in benchmark tests or is it quite the opposite?

title: Daily Authority: Musk buys Twitter
description: Elon Musk completed his purchase of Twitter, Apple's continued phone dominance, and a secret decommissioned Netflix server.

title: The iPhone 15 series could ditch physical volume/power buttons
description: Apple previously switched to haptic-driven keys with the iPhone 7's home button. Are volume and power keys next?

title: Google says it’s ‘very comfortable’ with Tensor not winning benchmarks
description: A Googler says the company prefers to test real-world workloads on its Pixel phones rather than synthetic benchmarks.

title: Apple is the only phone maker that posted positive growth this quarter
description: Chinese vendors suffered the most as worldwide smartphone shipments declined 9.7% compared to last year.

title: It’s official. Elon Musk now owns Twitter
description: And he's already fired former CEO Parag Agarwal, amongst others.

title: How to watch Twitch on Roku
description: You'll be back to watching games and DJ parties in no time.
